title: How to Renovate Old Tin Trays

steps.headline: Paint the tray with the undercoat.
steps.description: Add a little dash of the final coat enamel paint to make the painting colour smoother.

steps.headline: Once the tray has dried, sand it lightly.
steps.description: Wipe down with a rag that has been dipped into turpentine.

steps.headline: Paint with the enamel paint colour that you've chosen.
steps.description: Leave to dry. Depending on the make of the paint, this can take up to a week. The enamel layer should be as hard as possible.

steps.headline: Select a design and draw onto the tracing paper.
Use the soft lead pencil to rub the traced design onto the tray.
Paint the traced design using the black enamel paint.
Leave to dry once again.
steps.description: Once it has dried, wipe over with the rag again to clean it.

text: Gather the items you'll need. The items are listed below. Paint the tray with the undercoat. Add a little dash of the final coat enamel paint to make the painting colour smoother. Leave to dry overnight.  Once the tray has dried, sand it lightly. Wipe down with a rag that has been dipped into turpentine. Paint with the enamel paint colour that you've chosen. Leave to dry. Depending on the make of the paint, this can take up to a week. The enamel layer should be as hard as possible. Select a design and draw onto the tracing paper.  Use the soft lead pencil to rub the traced design onto the tray.  Paint the traced design using the black enamel paint. Use a fine brush. Leave to dry once again. Once it has dried, wipe over with the rag again to clean it.
